intro: Aulomyrcia rostrata, commonly known as the rostrated hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Aulomyrcia rostrata is often found in moist, well-drained soils in tropical and subtropical regions.
